Name: innisfree
AboutMe:
Of all the unimportant things in life, physics is the most important

Hat-tip to Arrigo Sacchi for this quote.

My interests are high-energy physics and phenomenology, and the application of (Bayesian) statistics in those topics.

I will arise and go now, and go to Innisfree, And a small cabin build there, of clay and wattles made; Nine bean rows will I have there, a hive for the honey bee, And live alone in the bee loud glade.

And I shall have some peace there, for peace comes dropping slow, Dropping from the veils of the morning to where the cricket sings; There midnight's all a glimmer, and noon a purple glow, And evening full of the linnet's wings.

I will arise and go now, for always night and day I hear lake water lapping with low sounds by the shore; While I stand on the roadway, or on the pavements grey, I hear it in the deep heart's core..
